intro: Siebera deflexa, commonly known as the flexible siebera, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, with five petals and prominent stamens. Siebera deflexa is often found in humid, shaded environments such as rainforests.
